snippet: A challenge to the Dodd-Frank power by some states is not compelling, yet questions remain over how authorities would deal with subsidiaries when a big financial institution fails.
abstract: A challenge to the Dodd-Frank power by some states is not compelling, yet questions remain over how authorities would deal with subsidiaries when a big financial institution fails.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
